summary: Email exchange between Audrey Strauss and an unnamed recipient discussing preparation for Ghislaine Maxwell's bail hearing and expressing gratitude for support on the Epstein and Maxwell cases. The email shows coordination and morale-boosting among prosecutors.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Sender of the email, offering congratulations and support to a team member preparing for Ghislaine Maxwell's bail hearing.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the upcoming bail hearing mentioned in the email.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as part of the cases the team is working on.

connections.description: Strauss, as US Attorney, is overseeing the prosecution of Maxwell.
Strauss's office is involved in the Epstein case.
Both are central figures in the cases being prosecuted by the office.

events.title: Email exchange regarding Maxwell bail hearing
events.description: Audrey Strauss and a team member discuss preparation for Ghislaine Maxwell's upcoming bail hearing.

keyFacts: The email is dated July 10, 2020, shortly after Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest.
It references preparation for Maxwell's bail hearing, described as 'the most popular bail hearing ever held'.
The correspondence shows internal support and coordination within the US Attorney's Office on the Epstein and Maxwell cases.
The recipient's name is redacted in the provided text.
